@DaReww @macd_trades I actually am not in all 🍎 products, had an iphone, ipad anf apple TV, but the fact I am not all in has nothing to do with my ability to recognize a great stock. I first noticed apple not cause of the I phone, but because I traveled and wanted an ipod to listen to music. I couldn't find one. Here was a company that under produced and had people lining up waiting for the new releases. I thought that was smart. Indeed, far as the iphone goes, it has, in a way becomes the companies attention getter for bringing new people intoit's ecosystem. That is why they've started putting out lower cost models to gain market share. They want to keep growing the hugh numbers of brand loyal life long customers... For over five decades I refused to even try another brand of ketchup or mayonnaise. A bad comparison, perhaps, but that is the type of brand loyalty 🍎 seeks to build. $aapl, my largest & most profitable position. My stocks are listed in my profile right up.
